poem:
Title: "The Wheel of Justice, Its Slow But Steady Turn"

In the silent halls of justice,
The wheel begins to chug,
Beneath a cloak of distractions,
Its motion won't budge.
Against the torrents of folly,
The procession steady and firm,
Echoes of truth never daunted,
Unfolding the legal worm.
In each refusal, a promise,
In each charge, a turbulent dance,
A tale told in hushed courtroom whispers,
In the end, leaving nothing to chance.
